Module videoPoker
Package videoPoker

Class VideoPoker

java.lang.Object
videoPoker.VideoPoker
public class VideoPoker extends Object
This class implements a generic Video Poker game.

The game requires an instance of Player that should return an Action at the appropriate times.

For the advice command to work, the game also needs to be provided an instance of Strategy that returns the optimal play for the respective kind of game.

The game can be played in two modes:

  • Regular Mode: This mode has no output except the ones asked by the player, and is played as an usual game, where the deck is shuffled after every play.
  • Debug Mode: This mode prints information about the game being played and requires a file with the available playing cards to be provided. The deck generated from these cards is never shuffled or reset.
Author:
Bernardo Silva, Miguel Madeira, Vicente Silvestre

  • Constructor Details

    • VideoPoker

      public VideoPoker(String handFile, String deckFile, Player player, Strategy strategy, boolean debugMode)
      Constructs a Video Poker game instance.

      Receives a file with the available poker hands and respective payouts, a file with the available cards, and an instance of a Player and Strategy.

      The game can be set to debug mode.

      Parameters:
      handFile - file containing the poker hands and respective payouts
      deckFile - file containing the available playing cards passed to the constructor of DeckOfCards
      player - instance of a Player
      strategy - instance of a Strategy
      debugMode - true if game should be played on debug mode

    • VideoPoker

      public VideoPoker(String handFile, Player player, Strategy strategy)
      Constructs a Video Poker game instance.

      Receives a file with the available poker hands and respective payouts, an instance of a Player and Strategy cards.

      The deck used is the standard 52 card deck.

      Parameters:
      handFile - file containing the poker hands and respective payouts
      player - instance of a Player
      strategy - instance of a Strategy

  • Method Details

    • playGame

      public void playGame()
      Begins playing the game.

      The game usually follows and repeats the sequence: bet -> deal -> hold.

      At every game phase, the game ask the player which action he wants to perform, expressed in the form of an instance of the class Action. The available actions are:

      CommandMeaning
      bbet
      $credit
      ddeal
      hhold
      aadvice
      sstatistics

      The game is played until there are no more actions. In debug mode, the game prints useful information to the Stdout and the deck is never reset or shuffled.
